g.text: Mathematical Models: A Catalog of Essential Functions
Use the linear model given by Equation 2 to estimate the average CO
level for 1987 and to predict the level for the year 2020. According to this model, when
1987, we estimate that the average CO

observed values. (±n fact, the Mauna Loa Observatory reported that the average CO
level in 1987 was 348.93 ppm, so our estimate is quite accurate.)
So we predict that the average CO
level in the year 2020 will be 405.4 ppm. This is an
because we have predicted a value
observations. Consequently, we are far less certain about the accuracy of our prediction.

We therefore predict that the CO
level will exceed 420 ppm by the year 2029. This
prediction is risky because it involves a time quite remote from our observations. ±n
fact, we see from Figure 6 that the trend has been for CO
rapidly in recent years, so the level might exceed 420 ppm well before 2029.

and so it is a linear function.
